蘴字的基本解释

蘴
fēng
古同“葑”，芜菁，一种草本植物，根肥大，有甜味，可作蔬菜。

蘴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fēng］
［《廣韻》敷容切，平鍾，敷。］
［《廣韻》敷隆切，平東，敷。］
(1)芜菁苗。
(2)茂盛。

蘴字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蘴； 康熙笔画：24； 页码：页1071第02
【唐韻】敷空切，音豐。【玉篇】蕪菁苗也。【揚子·方言】陳、楚之郊謂之蘴，魯、齊之郊謂之蕘，關東西謂之蕪菁，趙、魏謂之大芥。亦作葑。【爾雅疏】葑也，須也，蕪菁也，蔓菁也，薞蕪也，蕘也，芥也，七者一物也。　又【集韻】思融切，與菘通。【揚子·方言·註】蘴，舊音蜂，今江東音嵩，字作菘也。

蘴字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蘴字的起名意思

暂无。

Miasma
Basic explanation of words
Miasma
fēng
In ancient times, "Feng", turnip, a kind of herb, has a fat root and sweet taste, and can be used as a vegetable.
Miasma
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fēng］
["Guangyun" apply Rongqi, Pingzhong, apply. ]
["Guangyun" Fulongqie, Pingdong, Fu. ]
(1) Turnip seedlings.
(2) Lush.
Miasma
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [The Department of Words] 　蘴; Kangxi Strokes: 24; Page Number: Page 1071 No. 02
【Tang Yun】Empty cut, sound abundant. [Jade articles] Turnip seedlings also. [Yangtze Dialect] The suburbs of Chen and Chu are called the Pleiades, the suburbs of Lu and Qi are called the 荛, the Guandong is called the turnip, and Zhao and Wei are called the big mustard. Also for fun. 【Erya Shu】Fine, beard, turnip, vine, turnip, watermelon, mustard, seven are one thing.　[Jiyun] Thinking fusion, and tongs. [Yangtze Dialect Note] Pleiades, the old tone bee, today's Jiangdong tone song, the word is made of song.
